snippet: Led by NASA’s James E. Hansen, the study said it was nearly certain that events like the 2011 Texas heat wave were caused by the human release of greenhouse gases.
abstract: Study, led by NASA scientist James E Hansen and published online in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, finds that the percentage of the earth’s land surface covered by extreme heat in the summer has soared in recent decades; study also shows that it is nearly certain that these changes have been caused by the human release of greenhouse gases.
